tool.name: Paste
tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**This tool preserves column assignments of Query1** Paste merges two queries side by side. If the first (left) query contains column assignments such as chromosome, start, end and strand, these will be preserved. However, it you would like to change column assignments, use "edit attributes" link in the history item produced by this tool (see figure at the end of this help page).
-----
**Example**
Query 1::
a 1 a 2 a 3
Query 2::
20 30 40
Pasting them together will produce::
a 1 20 a 2 30 a 3 40
-----
Output of this tool preserves column assignments of the first query. To change these use "edit attributes" of the history item generated by this tool as shown here:
.. image:: ../static/images/SetAttr.png
